meanings.definition: Capable of being missed or overlooked.
meanings.sent1: The small sign was missable among the colorful decorations.
meanings.sent2: The important detail was easily missable in the lengthy report.
meanings.sent3: The missable clue led the detective on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: Her quiet presence was like a missable whisper in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The faint aroma of fresh cookies was almost missable but drew everyone to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Able to be avoided or bypassed.
meanings.sent1: The shortcut made the long line easily missable.
meanings.sent2: The warning signs were clearly missable by the distracted driver.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to be missable at the party failed when he knocked over the punch bowl.
meanings.sent4: The tempting offer was a missable distraction from his main goal.
meanings.sent5: The hidden path was almost missable, but it led to a beautiful secret garden.
